conclusion: The magnetic induction strength is B=5×10^{-3} T.
The charge-to-mass ratio is q/m=2×10^{6} C/kg.
The distance from the origin to the particle source is d=1.2 m.
The angle of incidence is θ=48.5°.
The sine of the angle is sin 48.5°=0.75.
Expression for the radius of the circular path: r=mv/qB.
Expression for the distance to the point where the particle hits the collection device: d=r sin θ.
Substitute r and sin θ into the equation: d=mv/qB sin θ.
Rearrange the equation to solve for v: v=qBd/m sin θ.
Substitute the given values into the equation: v=(2×10^{6} C/kg × 5×10^{-3} T × 1.2 m)/0.75.
Simplify the equation to find v: v=1.6×10^{6} m/s.
